title: Darryl Kyte
text:
Darryl Kyte is a lawyer, writer, producer and television personality in <a href="Canada">Canada</a>. Kyte hosted the <a href="Canadian%20Broadcasting%20Corporation">Canadian Broadcasting Corporation</a>'s <a href="International%20Emmy">International Emmy</a> and <a href="Gemini%20award">Gemini award</a> winning show <a href="Street%20Cents">Street Cents</a> and has worked as a journalist and producer for a number of other CBC news television programs.
Early life and education.
Born in <a href="Toronto">Toronto</a>, <a href="Ontario">Ontario</a>, Kyte attended <a href="Leaside%20High%20School">Leaside High School</a>. Kyte holds honors journalism and economics degrees from the <a href="University%20of%20King%27s%20College">University of King's College</a> and <a href="Dalhousie%20University">Dalhousie University</a> and a law degree from the <a href="Schulich%20School%20of%20Law">Schulich School of Law</a> at <a href="https%3A//www.dal.ca/">Dalhousie University</a>.
Career.
Kyte began working with <a href="http%3A//www.cbc.ca/streetcents/guide/">Street Cents</a> in 2000 appearing as 'Darryl the intern' on multiple episodes. In 2001 Kyte became a <a href="http%3A//www.cbc.ca/streetcents/archives/guide/thehosts.html">Street Cents host</a> a position he held for four <a href="http%3A//www.cbc.ca/streetcents/guide/">seasons</a>. Kyte’s co-host Kim D'Eon (2000–2003) appeared on <a href="Entertainment%20Tonight%20Canada">Entertainment Tonight Canada</a>. Kyte’s other co-hosts Alison Dixon (2003–2005) is currently a medical doctor and <a href="Connie%20Walker%20%28journalist%29">Connie Walker</a> (2001–2004) continues to work with the CBC.
Kyte has worked around the world as a writer, reporter and producer for CBC’s the National, various regional newscasts and CBC Sports. Kyte has also taken part in a number of independent television programs including <a href="https%3A//web.archive.org/web/20081206170739/http%3A//www.canada.com/tvtropolis/tv/thatnewsshow/index.html">That News Show</a> on <a href="TVtropolis">TVtropolis</a> and international health and medical media <a href="http%3A//www.thefreddies.com/index.aspx">Freddie Award</a> winning video P.A.R.T.Y.
Kyte articled and practiced at one of North America’s top music law firms.
